results.title: Messengers of peace
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Frank Jacobs
results.brief_description: This film looks at the philatelic aspects of United Nations’ stamps. The U.N. has a postal administration and used the mail routes of the world for its own unique international postage stamps. Some of the world’s leading artists prepare the designs, which appear on the stamps.

results.title: Messages: Yellow ball workshop
results.brief_description: A series of advice films for children. Three on diet; good food for energy, beauty and to prevent overweight. One on the dangers of listening to clever advertising and one on the possible embarrassment of not reading the label correctly.

results.title: Message from Moree (A) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Rymer Bayly Watson, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Bevan Childs and Judy Rymer
results.brief_description: Moree, several hours north-west of Sydney, once had the reputation for being New South Wales’ most racist town, particularly during the 1990s. A rich agricultural district of wealthy farmers, Moree also is home to a poverty-stricken mainly unemployed minority Aboriginal community, giving rise to a high crime rate, violence, racism, despair and social disintegration. By 1996 Moree was in crisis with unemployment for Aboriginals at 44% (non-Aboriginals 7%). Dick Estens, a cotton farmer whose passion for the underdog and a refusal to acknowledge or accept failure, set about with a private group of concerned citizens in establishing the AES (Aboriginal Employment Strategy). His mission was to gain employment for Aboriginal people through a process of mentoring and partnerships. This documentary follows the handover by Dick Estens of the leadership of the AES to the Aboriginal community and the appointment of Cathy Duncan, a young tenacious Aboriginal educator, as Chair of the AES. Together Cathy and Dick begin to inspire change in the town of Moree, bringing a new hope of reconciliation between blacks and whites, increased employment for Aboriginals and a more positive attitude and respect between the two cultures. The partnership between Dick and Cathy is an interesting one with suspicion slowly turning into trust, ignorance into understanding, despair into hope and eventually, through compromise, mutual respect and admiration for each other as they strive towards a common goal. An extraordinary story of a small community committed to change. Contains archival footage, some scenes in b&w. For more information see “www.abc.net.au/message/tv/docos/moree/”

results.title: Message from a dinosaur
results.brief_description: Explains how the past is reconstructed from fossil remains, how palaeontologists hypothesise about prehistoric life forms, and how new forms of life evolved from the environmental changes. Organisms which cannot adapt to changing conditions do not survive.

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Mesa Verde: Mystery of the silent cities
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: The ruins of a mysterious Pueblo Culture in the American South-West are probed in an attempt to reconstruct the lives and times of these fascinating people, who appeared suddenly, flourished and disappeared just as suddenly.

results.title: Merseyside
results.brief_description: A survey of the Mersey River, one of the main arterials of Britain’s commerce from its soucre in the Derbyshire hills to its estuary below the port of Liverppol. As the river enters the sea, it is lined with docks, shipyards, and warehouses, which serve the continuous traffic on the Mersey River.

results.title: Merry Christmas Mr Lawrence
results.creator_credit: Recorded Picture Company, Jeremy Thomas and Nagisa Oshima
results.brief_description: Set in a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp towards the end of World War II, the story subtly explores the bonds that develop between men in stressful situations; bonds that often transcend culture and inexplicably, sometimes, even transcend the barriers between captor and captive. Based on a novel by Sir Laurens Van Der Post. Stars David Bowie, Tom Conti, Jack Thompson and Ryuichi Sakamoto Takeshi.
